. Formed in 1991, they are regarded as one of the pioneers of the genre.

sound on their first 7", Skepticism soon began to evolve into a more distinctive style, a combination of slow
and death metal with prolific use of
sound. The keyboards intend to create a depressive sound, rather than the
bands using keyboards tend to focus on. This style was first heard on the
(1994), which was still up-tempo compared to the material that was to follow. The debut full-length
took that style a step further, consisting of six long and slow tracks with an average length of nearly ten minutes each.
After this, the band released its first 'pair', an
and album which are thematically connected:

was released, a one-track EP lasting almost 28 minutes, and another departure into different stylistic territory from the band. A variety of musical themes are explored before the song turns back upon itself and returns to the opening theme.
The band's latest releases were contained in the second 'pair',
(2003). These releases involve another slight departure from earlier releases, by introducing more elements of
, which was recorded live in studio.

Their long-time line-up was reached in early 1993 and consisted of a drummer, guitarist, organist and a vocalist. No changes in the line-up took place until 2015, when they adopted a second guitarist for the recording of
